intro: Strobocalyx elliptica, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is known for its compact growth habit. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth. Strobocalyx elliptica is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
